result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas C Neske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $700.00 fine plus costs.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

with Huber privileges.

IT IS HEREBY Ordered that the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward all restitution and outstanding fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court with attorney James Dickinson. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Guilty plea entered. Court finds factual basis and adjudges defendant guilty. Deportation warning given. Minutes filed.

Defendant Thomas C Neske in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Thomas C Neske.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas C Neske in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Thomas C Neske. Counsel enters not guilty plea on behalf of defendant. Counsel requests 45 day adjournment. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas C Neske in court.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson in court for Thomas C Neske. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Thomas C Neske in court. Zeke Wiedenfeld for the State of Wisconsin. Bond amended to add No Driving Without License. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 5-17-22: Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH (ALREADY POSTED)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
